alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 7:40PM EDT until March 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. .Due to rainfall over the last couple of days, Stillwater Creek is in minor flood, and has not crested yet. It is forecast to crest Sunday morning and remain in minor flood stage.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-261145- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0002.000000T0000Z-230327T2300Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.230325T0915Z.230326T1200Z.230327T1700Z.NO/ 740 PM EDT Sat Mar 25 2023 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. At 13.3 feet, Flood waters reach Newport Avenue in Uhrichsville as well as East 12th Street and North Main Street half way to East 11th Street. Phac Park along Little Stillwater Creek in Dennison is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Saturday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.1 feet on 11/13/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
